title: Ticket #7446: Enable condor_fetchlog with fine-grained auth
description:
Currently, condor_fetchlog contacts a remote daemon and performs a command to fetch the contents of a logfile.

With the introduction of fine-grained authentication, we do not envision startds acting as servers and establishing a new security session as the startd host has only a fine-grained token and not the password file.

We should take the lead from how the schedd / negotiator relationship currently works - the condor_master could advertise a capability to the collector and pre-register it as a security session. Then, any connection coming from that specific security session will be pre-authorized to fetch the log.
remarks:
2020-Jan-10 16:08:52 by tlmiller:
Results of our Thursday (2020-01-10) meeting (as I recall them):

  • Code to advertise a fine-grained capability should move into daemon core. (Off by default.)
  • We should take this opportunity to improve our forward-compatibility with respect to private attributes; some new attribute prefix should always be private.
  • We should think about startd flocking while implementing and this reviewing this; the first consequence is that we need a way to determine which collectors are trusted.
  • We should merge the patch which makes checking a socket for authorization a single function call.
  • We still want to explain this to Zach and have him review the idea (and, probably, some of the code).
